page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There has been a settlement here since before the time of the{Romans}as it has always been a convenient crossing point of the{Thames.}Two main changes shaped the history of{Cookham. The first in 987 when all the land locally was given as a gift to the monarch. Since the king was Lord of the{Manor}and generally lived elsewhere the villagers were allowed to manage their own affairs rather than be controlled directly from the Manor.The second change was in 1280 when the first bridge at{Maidenhead was built across nthe river.From then on{Cookham}ceased to grow in importance and was left as a sleepy village whilst{Maidenhead}continued to expand. We asked local people about changes which had occurred in the last twenty years. the{Rev. John Grover}came to
